sub_topic: Applying the Fourier transform to signal processing
message_1: Consider a continuous-time signal $x(t)$ with the Fourier transform $X(\omega)$. Suppose $x(t)$ is band-limited with a maximum frequency of 100 Hz. Calculate the values of $X(\omega)$ for $\omega$ greater than 200 Hz.
message_2:
Since the signal $x(t)$ is band-limited with a maximum frequency of 100 Hz, its Fourier transform $X(\omega)$ will have non-zero values only for frequencies within the range of -100 Hz to 100 Hz. For frequencies outside this range, the Fourier transform will be zero.

Therefore, for $\omega$ greater than 200 Hz, the value of $X(\omega)$ will be:

$X(\omega) = 0$ for $\omega > 200$ Hz.
